item.title: Apple Developing Face ID-Enabled Smart Doorbell for 2025-2026 Launch - Mobile ID World
item.description:
Apple Developing Face ID-Enabled Smart Doorbell for 2025-2026 Launch

Publication Date: December 22, 2024
Source: TechCrunch, MacRumors, FoneArena, 9to5Mac, Business Insider

Apple is venturing into the smart home market with a new smart doorbell that integrates Face ID technology, expected to launch in late 2025 or 2026.

  • Utilizes Face ID for facial recognition and wireless communication with smart locks.
  • Compatible with third-party HomeKit locks and possibly partnerships with specific lock manufacturers.
  • Focus on privacy and security with data protection and encrypted video storage.
  • Part of Apple's broader strategy to enhance its smart home device offerings amid a growing home security market.
  • Competitive landscape includes Amazon's Ring, with Apple's emphasis on privacy setting it apart.
“The home security market is expected to reach $81 billion, driven largely by smart lock adoption.”

Apple's entry into the smart doorbell sector aims to provide a privacy-focused alternative in a market increasingly scrutinized for data security practices.

item.title: Zebronics Zeb-Axon 200 Portable Speaker Now on Amazon - SMEStreet
item.description:
Zebronics Zeb-Axon 200 Portable Speaker Now on Amazon

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

The Zebronics Zeb-Axon 200 is a powerful portable speaker designed for exceptional sound quality and versatile use. With innovative features like Z-Sync Mode and robust design, it caters to music lovers both indoors and outdoors.

  • Features Z-Sync Mode for seamless pairing of over 100 speakers.
  • Pulsating 180W RMS output through 5 drivers and dual passive radiators.
  • IPX6 water resistance rating makes it suitable for outdoor use.
  • Easy-to-use controls and a long battery life of up to 10 hours.
  • Offers 3 EQ modes to customize sound output.
  • Available at an introductory price of Rs. 9,999/- on Amazon.
“Zebronics has pushed the boundaries of what a portable speaker can deliver with the Zeb-Axon 200. This is just not a speaker, it is a statement of how technology can transform how we relish music.” – Mr. Pradeep Doshi, Director & Co-Founder of Zebronics.

In conclusion, the Zeb-Axon 200 aims to deliver premium sound experiences in a portable format, making it a noteworthy addition to Zebronics' product lineup.

item.title: iOS 19 Will Support iPhone SE 2020 and All Other Models Running iOS 18: Report - Gadgets 360
item.description:
You Will Get iOS 19 Update If You Have Any of These iPhone Models

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Gadgets 360

Apple is set to release the iOS 19 update, which will be compatible with all iPhones currently using iOS 18. The rollout is expected in late 2025, covering a wide range of devices.

Key Points:

  • iOS 19 will support all iPhone models running iOS 18.
  • Latest models include the iPhone 16 series and older models like iPhone SE (2020).
  • iPadOS 19 may not support all iPad models, specifically iPad (7th generation).
"The update is slated for a late 2025 release."

The compatibility list for iOS 19 shows extensive support, which is a significant benefit for existing Apple users.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S24 series is available with big discount offers - India Today
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S24 series is available with big discount offers

Published On: Dec 23, 2024 | Published By: Aman Rashid

Samsung is offering significant discounts on the Galaxy S24 series and wearables, providing a great opportunity for customers during the holiday season.

  • Big discounts on Galaxy S24 series and wearables as part of the holiday sale.
  • Galaxy S24 Ultra starts at Rs 1,09,999 with additional cashback offers.
  • Galaxy S24 Plus priced at Rs 64,999 and Galaxy S24 at Rs 62,999.
  • Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Z Flip 6 prices reduced significantly.
  • Galaxy S23 series also sees considerable price drops.
  • Wearables like Galaxy Watch Ultra and Galaxy Buds series have attractive offers.
“Samsung hasn’t stopped at just smartphone deals.”

It's an opportune time for smartphone and wearable enthusiasts to take advantage of these discounts before the holiday season ends.

item.title: Vivo Y29 5G India price and specs leaked ahead of launch: All you need to know | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Vivo Y29 5G India Price and Specs Leaked Ahead of Launch

Publication Date: [Insert date here] Source: [Insert source here]

Vivo is set to launch a new budget smartphone, the Vivo Y29 5G, with leaks revealing its pricing and specifications ahead of confirmation.

  • Prices are expected to be ₹13,999 for 4GB RAM/128GB, ₹15,499 for 6GB RAM/128GB, ₹16,999 for 8GB RAM/128GB, and ₹18,999 for 8GB RAM/256GB.
  • The phone features a 6.68 inch display and MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor.
  • It sports a 5,500mAh battery with 44W fast charging.
  • Camera specifications include a 50MP primary sensor and an 8MP front camera.
  • Additional features include IP64 dust and water resistance, military-grade shock resistance, and dimensions of 8.1mm thickness, weighing 198 grams.
“Vivo Y29 5G is said to come in Glacier Blue, Titanium Gold, and Diamond Black colors.”

The Vivo Y29 5G promises to be a competitive option in the budget smartphone market with notable specifications and features.

item.title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra Allegedly Receives BIS Certification, Hints at Possible India Launch - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Xiaomi 15 Ultra Allegedly Gets BIS Approval, India Launch May Be Imminent

Publication Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Gadgets360

The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is expected to launch in India soon as it has been spotted on the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) website. It is anticipated to debut globally before arriving in India.

  • The device is associated with the model number 25010PN30I.
  • Expected to feature Snapdragon 8 Elite flagship chipset.
  • Previous Xiaomi 14 Ultra launched internationally in February and in India in March.
  • Rumored features include 90W wired charging, a 2K display, and advanced camera specifications.
“The appearance of Xiaomi 15 Ultra on the BIS certification platform suggests that it could arrive in India soon.”

In conclusion, the approval from BIS is a strong indicator that the Xiaomi 15 Ultra could soon make its way to the Indian market, garnering much anticipation among tech enthusiasts.

item.title: WhatsApp to end support for older Android phones from January 1, 2025: Full list here - The Financial Express
item.description:
WhatsApp to End Support for Older Android Phones Starting January 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Financial Express

In a significant move, Meta announced that WhatsApp will cease to support older Android devices beginning January 1, 2025. Users operating on Android KitKat and older versions will be unable to run the app, impacting millions globally.

Key Points

  • WhatsApp support will end for all Android devices running KitKat or older.
  • Users are encouraged to back up their data to newer devices.
  • Affected brands include Samsung, Motorola, HTC, LG, and Sony.
  • Meta previously announced similar plans for older iPhones.
  • Important backup tips provided to help users transition smoothly.

"If you are still using one of these devices as your daily driver, the logical way forward is to back up all your WhatsApp data to a newer device."

As WhatsApp phases out support for older systems, users must take proactive measures to move their data to updated devices to avoid losing access to their chat histories.

item.title: Should chess players invest in their diet? - Sportstar
item.description:
Should Chess Players Invest in Their Diet?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Hindu

The article explores the significant impact of diet on chess performance, arguing that nutrition plays a vital role in mental acuity and endurance during tournaments.

  • The myth that chess players burn 6,000 calories during tournaments is debunked; actual increased energy expenditure is roughly 200-300 calories.
  • Proper nutrition can improve memory, decision-making, focus, and stress management essential for optimal chess performance.
  • Certain foods, such as dark chocolate, nuts, and low-GI carbohydrates, are recommended for sustaining energy and sharp thinking.
  • Intermittent fasting and nootropic foods are noted as emerging trends to boost mental clarity.
  • Genetics can influence dietary needs, suggesting a personalized approach to nutrition may enhance performance.
“Chess is more than a game; it’s a test of endurance, focus, and mental agility.”

Ultimately, investing in a strategic diet may offer chess players a competitive edge, transforming their approach to the game.

item.title: OnePlus 13R confirmed to launch with Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC- All details - HT Tech
item.description:
OnePlus 13R Confirmed to Launch with Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC - All Details

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The OnePlus 13 series, including the OnePlus 13R, is set to launch on January 7, 2025, featuring significant upgrades and powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor.

Key Points

  • The OnePlus 13R will be available on Amazon with confirmed upgraded specifications.
  • It will come with AI-powered features like AI Notes and intelligent search functionalities.
  • Specifications include a 6.78-inch AMOLED display, 120Hz refresh rate, and triple camera setup including a 50MP main camera.
  • The smartphone will feature a 6000mAh battery with 80W fast charging support.
  • Design is expected to resemble the OnePlus 13 with color options of Astral Trail and Nebula Noir.
“The smartphone will also offer improved battery life with a 6000mAh battery.”

Stay tuned for more details following the China launch on December 26, 2025.

item.title: WhatsApp will stop working on these Android smartphones from January 1: Is yours on list? - The Indian Express
item.description:
WhatsApp to Stop Working on Older Android Smartphones from January 1

Date: December 20, 2023 Source: Indian Express

WhatsApp will discontinue support for over 20 older Android smartphones starting January 1, 2024, which primarily affects devices running Android KitKat or older. Users are advised to back up their chats to ensure data preservation.

  • Over 20 Android devices will lose access to WhatsApp from January 1, 2024.
  • Affected devices are mostly at least 10 years old.
  • Other Meta apps like Facebook and Instagram are also likely to become unsupported on these devices.
  • Brands affected include HTC and LG, which no longer manufacture smartphones.
“We recommend you back up all the WhatsApp chats to a Google account to ensure easy restoration of all the chats to a new smartphone.”

Users should consider upgrading their devices to maintain access to WhatsApp and other modern applications.

item.title: Galaxy S21 FE is one step closer to getting the One UI 7 update - SamMobile - Samsung news
item.description:
Galaxy S21 FE is one step closer to getting the One UI 7 update

Last updated: December 23rd, 2024 at 05:27 UTC+01:00 | Source: SamMobile

Samsung is progressing with the One UI 7 update for Galaxy S21 FE, spotted in internal test builds. However, the official rollout won't begin until after the Galaxy S25 launches in late January 2025.

  • Internal test builds for Android 15/One UI 7 have been identified.
  • The One UI 7 update is not expected to arrive before the Galaxy S25 series.
  • The update for Galaxy S21 FE may lag behind the other Galaxy S21 models following previous trends.
  • Android 15 will mark the last major Android OS upgrade for the Galaxy S21 series.
"Android 15 will be the last major Android OS upgrade for the Galaxy S21, S21+, and S21 Ultra."

The One UI 7 update is highly anticipated, with users hoping for enhanced features and improvements as Samsung continues to refine its software offerings.

item.title: Microsoft Brings AI-Powered Live Captions to Intel and AMD Copilot Plus Laptops - Gizbot
item.description:
Microsoft Brings AI-Powered Live Captions to Intel and AMD Copilot Plus Laptops

Published: Monday, December 23, 2024, 9:44 [IST]

Microsoft is bringing its AI-powered real-time translation feature to a broader audience, now available on Intel and AMD devices with the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview Build.

  • The AI real-time translation feature now supports over 44 languages, converting audio into English subtitles.
  • Users can utilize this feature in conference calls, YouTube videos, and podcasts, making content more accessible.
  • Previously only available to Snapdragon-based PCs, the update expands this service to a wider range of laptops.
  • Supported languages for translation include Spanish, French, Russian, Japanese, and more.
  • The feature will initially roll out to Windows Insiders in the Dev Channel.
“The update enhances our capabilities in multilingual environments and breaks down language barriers effectively.”

This advancement showcases Microsoft's commitment to enhancing accessibility and breaking language barriers across devices.

item.title: Forget keys, Face ID may soon lock and unlock your house doors: Apple exploring smart doorbells - India Today
item.description:
Forget keys, Face ID may soon lock and unlock your house doors: Apple exploring smart doorbells

Published On: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: Bloomberg

Apple is reportedly developing a Face ID-enabled smart doorbell that could unlock your door by recognising you, expected to launch by late 2025.

  • The device operates similarly to iPhone Face ID, ensuring privacy through the Secure Enclave chip.
  • It may work with existing HomeKit smart locks or through collaboration with other manufacturers.
  • Part of a broader initiative, Apple is enhancing its smart home ecosystem with various innovations.
  • Potential security concerns are raised regarding system malfunctions, but Apple prioritises user privacy.
  • Other innovations in development include a smart display and a security camera.
“If successful, this device could bring a new level of convenience and security to Apple users.”

item.title: Google Releases Android 16 Developer Preview 2 (DP2): All Details - News18
item.description:
Google Releases Android 16 Developer Preview 2 (DP2): All Details

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: News18

Google has released Android 16 Developer Preview 2 (DP2), which allows testing of new features and APIs. This update aims to enhance battery life and introduces a new fingerprint unlock functionality for Pixel devices.

  • Android 16 DP2 rolls out earlier than usual in 2025 as Google prepares for the Pixel 10 series.
  • The new setting, Screen-off Fingerprint Unlock, allows Pixel users to unlock devices with the screen off.
  • Improvements to battery life and app performance are highlighted in the update.
  • New haptic APIs will provide richer tactile feedback for applications.
"According to reports, the new feature may allow users to utilize fingerprint unlock even while the screen is off."

This latest version is a significant step in enhancing user experience, especially for Pixel owners.

item.title: Amazon’s App Store Has This Dangerous Android Health App That Can Steal Your Data - News18
item.description:
Amazon’s App Store Has This Dangerous Android Health App That Can Steal Your Data

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

The Amazon App Store has been flagged for hosting a dangerous health app, BMICalculationVsn, that is capable of stealing sensitive user data. This app poses a major security risk for its thousands of users.

  • The app was identified by McAfee Labs as a potential spyware.
  • It asks for unnecessary permissions, such as access to passwords and payment details.
  • The app disguises itself as a BMI calculator, misleading users about its true intentions.
  • Users are advised to delete the app immediately to protect their data.
  • Depending on third-party app stores increases the risk of exposure to malware.
"When you click on the calculate button... the app asks permission to start recording, which is completely pointless for an app in this genre." - McAfee Labs

With potential threats from third-party app stores, it is crucial for Android users to remain vigilant and ensure they use protective measures like Google Play Protect.
